text: Tabula Peutingeriana showing Ad PlumbariaAd Plumbaria was a civitas (town) of the Roman North AfricaE.W.B. Fentress , R. Warner, R. Talbert, T. Elliott, Ad Plumbaria , a Pleiades name resource. The town flourished from AD 300-AD 640. Barrington Atlas location 2000, p. 489 (pl. 31 unlocated). The town is shown on the Tabula Peutingeriana,Johannes Dominicus Podocatharos Christianopulos, Conradus Peutinger, Tabula itineraria militaris Romana antiqua Theodosiana et peutingeriana(Cherubinus, 1809) page iii. as being on the road to Hippo Regius.Matthias-Petrus Katancic, Orbis antiques ex tabula itineraria, quae Theodosii Imperatoris et ..., Volume 1(Universitas, 1824)page ixxxviii. The presumed ruins of the town were discovered in the mid 1800s in the middle of the Lake of Fetzara. ==References== Category:4th-century establishments in the Roman Empire Category:640s disestablishments in the Byzantine Empire Category:Populated places established in the 4th century Category:Populated places disestablished in the 7th century Category:Former populated places in Algeria Category:Roman towns and cities in Africa (Roman province) Category:Roman sites in Algeria
title: Ad Plumbaria
